projectPurpose: To provide the core graphical user interface for users to configure and customize the COSMIC desktop environment.
mainFeatures: Provides a graphical interface for configuring the COSMIC desktop environment.
Manages various system and desktop settings.
Written in Rust.
Integrated with the COSMIC desktop environment.
Modular design for adding/removing pages.

alternatives.name: GNOME Control Center
mainFeatures: Configures various aspects of the GNOME desktop.
Includes settings for appearance, hardware, network, and user accounts.
Provides an overview of available panels.
Features a search function for settings.
Main interface for GNOME desktop configuration.

alternatives.name: KDE System Settings
alternatives.license: Open Source - GPL-2.0 or later, LGPL-2.0-only, LGPL-3.0-only
mainFeatures: Comprehensive configuration for KDE Plasma desktop and system.
Includes settings for appearance, workspace, personalization, network, and hardware.
Features a search function.
Allows highlighting changed settings.
Highly customizable.

alternatives.name: XFCE Settings Manager
mainFeatures: Centralized configuration management for XFCE.
Provides dialogs for accessibility, appearance, and display.
Includes keyboard and mouse settings.
Manages preferred applications.
Configures panel, workspaces, and window manager.

alternatives.name: MATE Control Center
alternatives.license: Open Source - GPL-2.0 or later, GPLv2+, GPLv3+
mainFeatures: Main interface for MATE desktop configuration.
Manages appearance settings (themes, backgrounds).
Configures hardware like keyboard and mouse.
Includes network settings.
Provides tools for user and group management.

alternatives.name: LXQt Configuration Center
alternatives.license: Open Source - LGPL-2.1 or later, GPL-2.0 or later
mainFeatures: Summarizes and provides configuration GUIs for LXQt.
Includes appearance settings.
Configures keyboard, mouse, and display.
Manages file associations and locale.
Can integrate third-party configuration tools.

marketPositioning: COSMIC Settings is positioned as the native, integrated configuration application for the new COSMIC desktop environment. As a core component of COSMIC, which is built from scratch in Rust with a focus on Wayland, its market position is tied to providing a modern, performant, and cohesive settings experience tailored for the COSMIC DE. While facing established alternatives like GNOME Control Center and KDE System Settings, cosmic-settings differentiates itself by being part of a new, independent desktop environment seeking to offer a distinct user experience and leverage modern technologies, with a design that supports modularity for distribution-specific customizations.
